title.narrative: Tanzanie - Premier Projet de Réhabilitation de la Santé (FHRP)

description.narrative: Project interventions will benefit a broad spectrum of the undeserved population, particularly women and children, and assure a significant number of the population of quality primary health care.

Tanzania's First Health Rehabilitation Project is the result of a protracted dialogue between the Bank Group and the GOT on the need to develop the country's primary and secondary health facilities in tandem with the tertiary health services as per the principles of Primary Health Care and in line with the Bank' s revised Health Sector Policy Paper. The project was programmed to be implemented over a period of 5years, beginning in June, 1998 and ending in December 2002. It consists of the following 5 components: i) Health Faciltties; ii) Institutional Support and Training; iii) Support to National HIV/AIDS Control Programme; iv) Integrated Prevention and Control of Endemic Diseases in Zanzibar; v) Project Management
The project objective is to provide expanded and improved delivery of primary health care services and support to the integrated control of endemic diseases.

participating-org.narrative: Government Of Tanzania, United Republic of
